request.lesson_description: Understanding the six types of simple machines: lever, pulley, wheel and axle, inclined plane, wedge, and screw. Exploring their practical applications in everyday life and historical significance.
request.learning_standard: Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS): 3-5-ETS1-2 - Generate and compare multiple solutions to a problem based on how well they meet the criteria and constraints of the design problem.
request.additional_guidance: Include real-world examples such as how levers are used in seesaws, pulleys in elevators, and inclined planes in ramps. Focus on how these machines reduce effort and make tasks easier.
